title: 2005 Apulian regional election
text:
The Apulian regional election of 2005 took place on 3–4 April 2005.
<a href="Nichi%20Vendola">Nichi Vendola</a> (<a href="Communist%20Refoundation%20Party">Communist Refoundation Party</a>) defeated incumbent <a href="Raffaele%20Fitto">Raffaele Fitto</a> (<a href="Forza%20Italia">Forza Italia</a>). The success of Vendola came somewhat unexpected. In a <a href="Southern%20Italy">Southern Italian</a> Region, expected to be morally conservative, Vendola, a <a href="Communism">communist</a> and <a href="Homosexuality">homosexual</a>, defeated Fitto, a conservative <a href="Christian%20democracy">Christian democrat</a>. Vendola was the first candidate ever to be appointed by its coalition through a <a href="primary%20election">primary election</a> instead of agreements between parties. A defeat of Vendola might have resulted in a cancellation of the <a href="The%20Union%20%28political%20coalition%29%23Primary%20elections">primary election of The Union</a> for choosing the candidate for Prime Minister in the <a href="2006%20Italian%20general%20election">2006 general election</a>.
Centre-left primary election.
The centre-left candidate was chosen through primary elections, which were won by surprise by Nichi Vendola.
